alert.note: Alert for Houston; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:19AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stewart and northeastern Houston Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 918 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Paris Landing State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dover, Erin, Tennessee Ridge, Big Rock, Cumberland City, Land Between The Lakes, Houston County Airport and Indian Mound. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Kentucky Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
